item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: Tanka Theme Demo
item.description: Tanka is a Bootstrap-based minimalist theme for Hugo. Vik, Iceland. Photo by Adam Jang. Typography Follows the Bootstrap typography. h1 Heading h2 Heading h3 Heading h4 Heading h5 Heading h6 Heading This is bold text This is bold text This is italic text This is italic text Deleted text Block quotes are written like so. They can span multiple paragraphs, if you like. Some text, and some code and then a nice plain link with title.

item.description: Some useful Bootstrap 4 components are listed below. This is a secondary alert—check it out! This is a success alert—check it out! This is a danger alert—check it out! This is a warning alert—check it out! This is a info alert—check it out!

item.title: About Malika
item.description: 我是张小雅，英文名字Malika，一个编程小白。这里将会记录我的学术成果及日常生活，谢谢。

item.title: Bayesian Linear Regression
item.description: Bayesian linear regression Given a dataset \(D = \{(x_i,y_i),i=1,...,n\},x_i\in R^p,y_i\in R\) The target variable y is given by a multiple linear model: \(y=X\beta+\epsilon\) with \(p(\epsilon)=N(0,\sigma_e^2)\) Bayesian theory is \(p(\beta|D)=\frac {p(D|\beta)p(\beta)}{p(D)}\) Known quntity precondition We assume that information on correlation structure \(\begin{Bmatrix}x_j\end{Bmatrix}\) is available Use the least square estimate to get the estimated information about \(\beta\) \(\hat \beta_j=(X^T_jX_j)^{-1}X_j^Ty\) \(\hat \sigma_j^2=(nX^T_jX_j)^{-1}(y-X_j\hat \beta_j)^T(y-X_j\hat \beta_j)\) \(S_j^2=\hat \sigma_j^2+n^{-1}\hat \beta_j^2\), \(j\in\lbrace1,.
